result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Lemar Green

records.addlTxt: Appointment Of An Attorney, Signed and Filed

Defendant Maurice Lemar Green in court in person, in custody.  Nicholas Conrardy appears by video as a friend of the court for Maurice Lemar Green. Attorney Emily S Zimmel appeared on behalf of Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Of Counsel. Defendant appears in court without counsel.  Defendant is eligible for public defender representation. SPD still has not appointed counsel. Court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Nicholas Conrardy who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Case adjourned for a Bail Review in Branch 06.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Maurice Lemar Green not in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant in custody. Initial Appearance has been held. SPD has not appointed counsel. State informs the court that the defendant is not represented on his pending Felony matter either. Court orders case adjourned for a Status Of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Oral No Contact Order with 744 N Vel Phillips Ave., Springhill Suites by Marriott

Defendant Maurice Lemar Green appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Maurice Lemar Green.  Attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Due to rotation of judge, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6. Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
